-  _I suggest we line them up with the top of the title block, like we do in the catalog._ I think I know what you are talking about but want to confirm. I think moving the thumbnail up toward the bookmark checkbox, like that of the online catalog makes sense.  From what I can see, it is the bookmark that is in alignment with the title, followed by the thumbnail beneath, with less padding in between. Is this correct? dspace-development.title: Disable DataSpace Item submission e-mail messages from user accounts steven.knowlton and sahoward

comments.body: I suspect that this is somehow related to the e-mail subscription feature described within https://wiki.lyrasis.org/display/DSDOC5x/Email+Subscriptions

While the functionality for this is located within `org.dspace.eperson.Subscribe`, I cannot find exactly where this is being invoked. There is, however, a database table referenced within the source code base.

I cannot find any `subscription` records:

```sql
dataspace_prod_db=> SELECT sub.* FROM subscription AS sub;
 subscription_id | eperson_id | collection_id
-----------------+------------+---------------
(0 rows)
```
This appears to have been due to a misconfiguration of group membership in Reviewers in DataSpace.  I think we can close this issue, as group membership has been adjusted.

https://git.atmire.com/clients/princeton-5/-/blob/dataspace-prod/dspace-api/src/main/java/org/dspace/workflow/WorkflowManager.java#L550 is likely where this is actually being triggered, it appears that there is some group which is receiving messages which should not.

`periodicals_public` (Group 3975) includes within it the Group `Lib_DigPubs_Submitters` (202), which itself contains two member Groups:

- `Lib_DigPubs_Reviewers` (203)
- `Lib_DigPubs_Approvers` (204)
`Lib_DigPubs_Submitters` contains the user accounts for steven.knowlton@ and sahoward@.
This has been resolved by @kelynch with a correction made to nested Group memberships.

figgy.title: Use omniauth-rails-csrf_protection gem to resolve CVE-2015-9284

comments.body: @eliotjordan might want to look into this. The omniauth-rails-csrf_protection gem works for `link_to` methods, but not for `redirect_to` as it can only function as a get method. I've found only two options for implementing this gem: one is two allow `redirect_to` to operate without the protection from the gem, and the other is to add an additional page to the website (effectively replace each `redirect_to` with a `link_to).

orangelight.title: Make fallback text for a portfolio 'Online Content' until extraneous portfolios are removed

comments.body:
Darn. I think the code to default the "Full Text" label happens at index time and not in Orangelight. See: https://github.com/pulibrary/bibdata/blob/main/marc_to_solr/lib/electronic_portfolio_builder.rb#L68-L70

We should still update it in bibdata so that the next reindex avoids the misleading label.

In the case of MMS_ID `99124695833506421` the issue is that both items are within the same holding (`holding_id="22745884920006421"`) and we collapse, by holding id, the information that we return to Orangelight  ([code](https://github.com/pulibrary/bibdata/blob/main/app/adapters/alma_adapter/availability_status.rb#L32-L43)). 

In this case collapsing this data hides from the user the fact that we have two copies and that one of them is on reserves.

We do have the information about both items in the Alma response 

```
{ "pid"=>"23898873500006421", "barcode"=>"32101109060713" ... }
{ "pid"=>"23745884910006421", "barcode"=>"32101104014996" ...} 
```

but both of them come with the exact same location information:

```
"library"=>{"value"=>"lewis", "desc"=>"Lewis Library"}, 
"location"=>{"value"=>"stacks", "desc"=>"Stacks: Lewis Library"},
```

The only indication that one of them is in reserves is in a note field:

```
"internal_note_3"=>"ON_RESERVE: N | RESERVE_CHARGES: 0 | RECALLS_PLACED: 0 | HOLDS_PLACED: 0 | HISTORICAL_BOOKINGS: 0 | SHORT_LOAN_CHARGES: 0 | ", 
```
